FuncDef:
The mpls rsvp-te peer command configures an RSVP neighbor relationship and displays the MPLS RSVP-TE neighbor view.
The undo mpls rsvp-te peer command deletes an RSVP neighbor relationship.
By default, no RSVP neighbor relationship is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Peer IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
RSVP-TE has been enabled before the mpls rsvp-te peer command is run.
The mpls rsvp-te peer command is run on two neighboring nodes to configure an RSVP neighbor relationship. Between two RSVP neighboring nodes, other functions, such as authentication and handshake can be configured. The mpls rsvp-te peer command provides either of the following functions based on the specified IP address:
If peer-addr is a neighbor LSR ID, an RSVP neighbor relationship is established on an entire node.If peer-addr is an interface address, an RSVP neighbor relationship is established on an interface.
